Trial_Design.evidence: two‐centre, stratified, parallel‐group, placebo‐controlled, double‐blind RCT

Participants.evidence: Patients undergoing mastectomy with or without axillary lymph node clearance

Intervention.evidence: moistening of wound surface before closure with either 25 mg/ml TXA or 0·9 per cent sodium chloride (placebo)

Objective.evidence: The aim of this study was to investigate whether moistening a surgical wound with TXA before closure, leaving a thin film of drug only, would reduce postoperative bleeding.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was postoperative bleeding as measured by drain production in the first 24 h.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between 1 January 2016 and 31 August 2018, 208 patients were randomized.

Number_Analysed.evidence: 202 patients were included in the study (101 in the TXA and 101 in the placebo group).

Result_Outcome.evidence: TXA reduced mean drain production at 24 h (110 versus 144 ml; mean difference 34 (95 per cent c.i. 8 to 60) ml, P = 0·011).

Harms.evidence: One patient in the TXA group had early haematoma compared with seven in the placebo group
